title: Bill Murray joins pal Frances McDormand on the red carpet at Rome Film Festival
text:
He is rumoured to be returning to the big screen in the latest Ghostbusters film next year.

And Bill Murray led a masterclass on acting at the 14th Rome Film Festival on Saturday accompanied by his pal fellow star Frances McDormand.

The Oscar-nominated actor, 69, teamed a royal blue fedora with a classic black tuxedo as he posed up a storm on the Italian film festival's red carpet.

Dapper: Bill Murray led a masterclass on acting at the 14th Rome Film Festival on Saturday - accompanied by his pal fellow star Frances McDormand

Frances, 62, held two fingers up behind her former co-star's head at one point as the pair shared in-jokes ahead of a masterclass at the event, the duo starred together in Moonrise Kingdom in 2012.

The Three Billboards actress styled a long contemporary art dress with a pair of red Birkenstock sandals and similarly coloured pearl drop earrings.

She wore her short grey hair in a lightly tousled style and went make-up free.

Old friends: The Oscar-nominated actor, 69, teamed a royal blue fedora with a classic black tuxedo as he posed up a storm on the Italian film festival's red carpet

Messing around: Frances, 62, held two fingers up behind her former co-star's head at one point as the pair posed for cameras ahead of a masterclass at the Italian event

Bill was unusually reserved in his outfit choice after being pictured wearing a delightful pink golfing vest, along with a plethora of other wardrobe elements, during an outing in New York City last Friday.

During that trip he donned a white bucket hat with red stripes on his head, and wore a black bandanna around his neck.

The Garfield actor kept the lower half of his ensemble relatively low-key, with black pants and black and red trainers.

Looking suave: The Broken Flowers actor is rumoured to be reprising his iconic role of Dr. Peter Venkman in the new Ghostbusters reboot, Ghostbusters 2020

Leading actor: Murray portrayed the lovelorn paranormal investigator in 1984's iconic Ghostbusters as well as 1989's sequel Ghostbusters II, opposite love interest Sigourney Weaver as Dana Barrett

Comeback? According to its IMDb page, the new Ghostbusters movie seems to have landed all of the surviving original cast, Weaver included, but Murray's credit is still listed with the word 'rumoured' alongside his name

Casual chic: The Three Billboards actress styled a long contemporary art dress with a pair of red Birkenstock sandals and similarly coloured pearl drop earrings

Under his vest, Bill wore a grey long-sleeved turtleneck in the autumnal New York weather, and added an additional layer in the form of a vintage black concert t-shirt, believed to be from an Eric Clapton show.

The Broken Flowers actor is rumoured to be reprising his iconic role of Dr. Peter Venkman in the new Ghostbusters reboot, Ghostbusters 2020, which is slated for release next July.

Murray portrayed the lovelorn paranormal investigator in 1984's iconic Ghostbusters as well as 1989's sequel Ghostbusters II, opposite love interest Sigourney Weaver as Dana Barrett.

According to its IMDb page, the new Ghostbusters movie seems to have landed all of the surviving original cast, Weaver included, but Murray's credit is still listed with the word 'rumoured' alongside his name.

Good pals: Frances sat on Bill's knee as the pair answered questions during a Masterclass at the 14th Rome Film Festival

By way of new blood, Ghostbusters 2020 will also feature Paul Rudd, Stranger Things' Finn Wolfhard, The Leftovers' Carrie Coon, and Bokeem Woodbine.

Outside of ghostbusting, however, Murray has his hands full with a fair spate of other supernatural-themed movies, having headlined The Dead Don't Die earlier this year, and with a repeat cameo in this month's sequel Zombieland: Double Tap.

Additionally, the cult actor is re-teaming with two of his beloved prior directors for new films: for On the Rocks, he will be again working with his Lost In Translation helmer Sofia Coppola, and Wes Anderson will yet again be featuring Murray, after films like Rushmore and The Life Aquatic, for The French Dispatch.

Both of those films are due on 1 January 2020.
